result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM; Case called for Pretrial conference. Defendant Nickolas G Gorski in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Nickolas G Gorski.  Prosecuting attorney Jayne Davis Dewire in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Menden provides an update; her client has another case in another county and she would like to discuss the matters with the attorney in that matter before resolving this case.  Atty. Menden requests projected plea and sentencing before the Judge assigned in January.  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.

2:09 PM  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.
Defendant Nickolas G Gorski in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Nickolas G Gorski. 
Atty Menden requests matter be placed on the pretrial calendar along with an offer. 
State will forward offer. 
Court places matter on pretrial calendar.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eryn Menden has been appointed to represent the defendant.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

01:25 PM Defendant Nickolas G Gorski in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
